alert.note: Alert for Galveston; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 8:24AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Galveston and Harris. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 824 AM CDT, An NWS employee reported heavy rain and minor flooding in poor drainage areas such as Interstate 45 construction areas and feeder roads due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past 15 minutes to an hour. - Poor drainage areas such as feeder road and construction areas are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are expected over the area. This additional rain will contribute to minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Pasadena, League City, Texas City, eastern Friendswood, Dickinson, southwestern Seabrook, Webster, Clear Lake, Nassau Bay, Clear Lake Shores and The Johnson Space Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
